model.comment: SC82 is a stationary decoder, but it can be programmed in the usual way

variable.tooltip: Range 1-16000, max value of 127 when programming via DCC
variable.label: Ops Mode Address

variable.tooltip: Only in SC82 version 16 and later
variable.label: Start up delay

enumChoice.choice: Move servos to the other end
Move servos to the other end

label.text: Use this number to set the address number
of the device the output is connected to.
Warning! be sure to allow 3 addresses per servo when in mode 2.
The Custom Programmer format is recommended
Note: Changes to Option CVs are not recognized until SC82 power is cycled.
Opt4 Enable gateway for DCC commands from track to bus
- Requires bus interface and DCC control to be enabled
Opt5 Enable transmit and receive on bus
Opt6 Enable receiving DCC commands from track
- When disabled, DCC gateway is disabled
Note: In a Digitrax system the bus is called LocoNet
Max value of 127 when using DCC
Values greater than 127 can be used with Loconet
Opt7 Disable power save - not recommended
Note: Power save reduces SC82 current draw
Opt8 Enable to invert the drive for all outputs
Opt1 Send input state at power on
Opt2 Send output state at power on
Opt5 Send primary input state at Digitrax interrogation request
Opt4 Send output state at Digitrax interrogation request
Opt5 Use one LED output for servo state indication instead of 2
---- Sets the SC82 to a particular test state - Use to help adjust servos ----
Changes the value of CV7 (Version ID) as displayed in DP
Test State may change when Version ID is read

display.tooltip: Sends opposite switch state from previous send - Switch Request only

Inverts the normal state of Close when input goes hi

label.text: When a switch (turnout) throw command is issued that matches this address the SC82 inputs are disabled.
When a close command is issued with this address the inputs are enabled.
This feature is useful for dispatcher control when the SC82 inputs are used for local turnout control.
---- Sets the output state at power on ----
Note: If a sensor message is selected to execute a route then
switch state c and t is used for sensor hi and lo respectively.
